milestones.text: Get familiar with Unity's user interface and workflow. Explore the menus, windows and panels that youâ€™ll use every day when creating games in Unity.

Start with the basics: work through the official tutorials. These tutorials will teach you the basics of the Unity engine and help you get comfortable with both the user interface and the underlying concepts.
Move on to more intermediate tutorials, such as game development with physics, animation, scripting, graphics, AI and networking.
Get creative by exploring different game genres, such as 3D platformers, strategy games, or other types of games.
Dig into the advanced topics of augmented reality and virtual reality with Unity.
Test and refine your skills with a project or two. Work on small prototypes or complete games and share them with your friends or the community.
Follow Unity's blog, updates and tutorials to stay up to date with the latest features and get tips and tricks from the professionals.
